ca.ualberta.cs.oneclick_cookbook

Class AddIngredientsActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • ca.ualberta.cs.oneclick_cookbook.AddIngredientsActivity

  • public class AddIngredientsActivity
extends Activity
    Class that allows for the addition of ingredients to recipes. Associates the entered ingredients with the current recipe, and adds them accordingly.
    Author:
    Kenneth Armstrong

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddIngredientsActivity

        public AddIngredientsActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Function that is called whenever the screen should be updated. Updates the spinners and the list view, providing immediate feedback to the user.

      • setUpSpinner

        public void setUpSpinner()
        Function that sets up the ingredient measurement spinner. The default is mL, there are several other measurements available.

      • setUpListView

        public void setUpListView()
        Function that sets up the list view that contains the ingredients. This allows the user to immediately receive feedback on the ingredients they have entered, as well as allowing them to long press to delete ingredients.

      • onAdd

        public void onAdd()
        Function that is called when the user clicks the add ingredient button. Adds the ingredient to the recipe. Also refreshes the view to show the new ingredient.

      • onDeleteAll

        public void onDeleteAll()
        Function that is called when the user clicks on the delete all button. Deletes all of the ingredients, and updates the pantry accordingly.

      • showMessage

        public void showMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Shows a message to the user in the current activity
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display

      • onDone

        public void onDone()
        Function that is called when the user clicks done. Ends the activity.

      • clickHandler

        public void clickHandler(View v)
        Function that handles the clicks from a user. Calls appropriate function for the button.
        Parameters:
        v - The view of the button that was clicked.
